intro: Sparganium minimum var. borderi, commonly known as the narrowleaf bur-reed, is a herbaceous wetland plant native to North America. It typically grows in shallow water or damp soil, often found in marshes, ponds, and along the edges of lakes. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into spiky, cone-like structures called burrs. It is characterized by its compact size and ability to thrive in aquatic environments. This species plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
